panoptes.utils.logger module¶

class panoptes.utils.logger.Logger(log_level='info', profile=None)[source]¶

Bases: builtins.object

Sets up the logger for our program. The has_logger class decorator allows this to be applited to classes within a project

config = {'name': 'Panoptes Base #1 Local', 'log': {'dir': './', 'log_dir': '/var/log/Panoptes/', 'log_format': '%(asctime)23s %(name)15s %(levelname)8s: %(message)s', 'log_level': 'info', 'file': 'panoptes.log', 'log_file': 'panoptes.log', 'log_profile': 'PanoptesLogger'}, 'site': {'elevation': 100.0, 'lon': '-155.0896126', 'lat': '19.7015883'}, 'mount': {'model': 'ioptron', 'port': '/dev/ttyUSB0'}}¶

Send an critical message

Send an info message

warning(msg)[source]¶

Send an warning message

panoptes.utils.logger.has_logger(Class, level='info')[source]¶

The class decorator. Adds the self.logger to the class. Note that log level can be passed in with decorator so different classes can have different levels

panoptes.utils.logger.set_log_level(level='info')[source]¶

Actually set up the Thrad and connect to serial

logger = <panoptes.utils.logger.Logger object at 0x2ab899100dd8>¶
read()[source]¶

Reads value using readline If no response is given, delay and then try to read again. Fail after 10 attempts

write(value)[source]¶

For now just pass the value along to serial object
